referencingComponents.name: Send activity restored event to EB

entry.key: FlowFile attributes to receive as message headers (Regex)

value.description: Determines how much time must elapse before considering the flow to be inactive
value.name: Threshold Duration

value.description: If true, will send inactivity indicator continually every Threshold Duration amount of time until activity is restored; if false, will send an indicator only when the flow first becomes inactive
value.name: Continually Send Messages

value.description: The message that will be the content of FlowFiles that are sent to the 'inactive' relationship
value.name: Inactivity Message

value.description: The message that will be the content of FlowFiles that are sent to 'activity.restored' relationship
value.name: Activity Restored Message

value.description: If true, will copy all flow file attributes from the flow file that resumed activity to the newly created indicator flow file
value.name: Copy Attributes

entry.value: Lacking activity as of time: ${now():format('yyyy/MM/dd HH:mm:ss')}; flow has been inactive for ${inactivityDurationMillis:toNumber():divide(60000)} minutes
Activity restored at time: ${now():format('yyyy/MM/dd HH:mm:ss')} after being inactive for ${inactivityDurationMillis:toNumber():divide(60000)} minutes

relationships.description: This relationship is used to transfer an Activity Restored indicator when FlowFiles are routing to 'success' following a period of inactivity
relationships.name: activity.restored

relationships.description: This relationship is used to transfer an Inactivity indicator when no FlowFiles are routed to 'success' for Threshold Duration amount of time
relationships.name: inactive

relationships.description: All incoming FlowFiles are routed to success
relationships.name: success

value.description: address where outbound message will be published
value.name: outbound address

value.description: HTTP request method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS).
value.name: HTTP Method

value.description: Remote URL which will be connected to, including scheme, host, port, path.
value.name: Remote URL

value.description: The SSL Context Service used to provide client certificate information for TLS/SSL (https) connections.
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: Max wait time for connection to remote service.
value.name: Connection Timeout

value.description: Max wait time for response from remote service.
value.name: Read Timeout

value.description: Include an RFC-2616 Date header in the request.
value.name: Include Date Header

value.description: Follow HTTP redirects issued by remote server.
value.name: Follow Redirects

value.description: Regular expression that defines which attributes to send as HTTP headers in the request. If not defined, no attributes are sent as headers.
value.name: Attributes to Send

value.description: The username to be used by the client to authenticate against the Remote URL. Cannot include control characters (0-31), ':', or DEL (127).
value.name: Basic Authentication Username

value.description: The password to be used by the client to authenticate against the Remote URL.
value.name: Basic Authentication Password

value.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the proxy server
value.name: Proxy Host

value.description: The port of the proxy server
value.name: Proxy Port

relationships.description: FlowFile will be routed on any type of connection failure, timeout or general exception.
relationships.name: Failure

relationships.description: FlowFile will be routed on any status code that should NOT be retried (1xx, 3xx, 4xx status codes).
relationships.name: No Retry

relationships.description: Original FlowFile will be routed upon success (2xx status codes).
relationships.name: Original

relationships.description: Response FlowFile will be routed upon success (2xx status codes).
relationships.name: Response

relationships.description: FlowFile will be routed on any status code that can be retried (5xx status codes).
relationships.name: Retry

value.description: address where outbound message will be published
value.name: outbound address

value.description: Regular expression that defines which attributes to send as HTTP headers in the request. If not defined, no attributes are sent as headers.

processors.name: Store all IoT events in MarkLogic

relationships.description: FlowFile will be routed on any type of connection failure, timeout or general exception.
relationships.name: Failure

relationships.description: FlowFile will be routed on any status code that should NOT be retried (1xx, 3xx, 4xx status codes).
relationships.name: No Retry

relationships.description: Original FlowFile will be routed upon success (2xx status codes).
relationships.name: Original

relationships.description: Response FlowFile will be routed upon success (2xx status codes).
relationships.name: Response

relationships.description: FlowFile will be routed on any status code that can be retried (5xx status codes).
relationships.name: Retry

value.description: Indicates whether the results of the JsonPath evaluation are written to the FlowFile content or a FlowFile attribute; if using attribute, must specify the Attribute Name property. If set to flowfile-content, only one JsonPath may be specified, and the property name is ignored.
value.name: Destination

value.description: Indicates the desired return type of the JSON Path expressions. Selecting 'auto-detect' will set the return type to 'json' for a Destination of 'flowfile-content', and 'scalar' for a Destination of 'flowfile-attribute'.
value.name: Return Type

value.description: Indicates how to handle missing JSON path expressions when destination is set to 'flowfile-attribute'. Selecting 'warn' will generate a warning when a JSON path expression is not found.
value.name: Path Not Found Behavior

value.description: Indicates the desired representation of JSON Path expressions resulting in a null value.
value.name: Null Value Representation

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath cannot be evaluated against the content of the FlowFile; for instance, if the FlowFile is not valid JSON
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath does not match the content of the FlowFile and the Destination is set to flowfile-content
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: The hostname of the SMTP host
value.name: SMTP Hostname

value.description: The Port used for SMTP communications
value.name: SMTP Port

value.description: Username for the SMTP account
value.name: SMTP Username

value.description: Password for the SMTP account
value.name: SMTP Password

value.description: Flag indicating whether authentication should be used
value.name: SMTP Auth

value.description: Flag indicating whether TLS should be enabled
value.name: SMTP TLS

value.description: Socket Factory to use for SMTP Connection
value.name: SMTP Socket Factory

value.description: X-Mailer used in the header of the outgoing email
value.name: SMTP X-Mailer Header

value.description: Mime Type used to interpret the contents of the email, such as text/plain or text/html
value.name: Content Type

value.description: Specifies the Email address to use as the sender
value.name: From

value.description: The recipients to include in the To-Line of the email
value.name: To

value.description: The recipients to include in the CC-Line of the email
value.name: CC

value.description: The recipients to include in the BCC-Line of the email
value.name: BCC

value.description: The email subject
value.name: Subject

value.description: The body of the email message
value.name: Message

value.description: Specifies whether or not the FlowFile content should be attached to the email
value.name: Attach File

value.description: Specifies whether or not all FlowFile attributes should be recorded in the body of the email message
value.name: Include All Attributes In Message

relationships.description: FlowFiles that fail to send will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles that are successfully sent will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

allowableValues.description: A copy of the FlowFile will be routed to each relationship whose corresponding expression evaluates to 'true'
Requires that all user-defined expressions evaluate to 'true' for the FlowFile to be considered a match
Requires that at least one user-defined expression evaluate to 'true' for hte FlowFile to be considered a match

value.description: Specifies how to determine which relationship to use when evaluating the Expression Language
value.name: Routing Strategy

relationships.description: FlowFiles that do not match any user-define expression will be routed here
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: The address where this processor will subscribe to eventBus to receive messages
value.name: inbound address

entry.key: Max Data to Receive per Second

value.description: The maximum amount of data to receive per second; this allows the bandwidth to be throttled to a specified data rate; if not specified, the data rate is not throttled
value.displayName: Max Data to Receive per Second
value.name: Max Data to Receive per Second

value.description: The Controller Service to use in order to obtain an SSL Context
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: A Regular Expression to apply against the Distinguished Name of incoming connections. If the Pattern does not match the DN, the connection will be refused.
value.name: Authorized DN Pattern

value.description: The maximum amount of time to wait for a FlowFile to be confirmed before it is removed from the cache
value.name: Max Unconfirmed Flowfile Time
